cosmerge modules and API reference¶

cosmerge.catgen Module¶

class for generating catalogs

Classes¶

Catalog(dat_path, sfh_model, met_grid, ...)

Class for building a generic catalog of merging compact objects from COSMIC data in metallicity grid

Class Inheritance Diagram¶

cosmerge.usample Module¶

methods to build cosmic merger populations

Functions¶

draw_metallicities_and_redshifts(mets, ns, ...)

Generator for draws of formation metallicities and redshifts from a log-normal metallicity distribution based on Madau & Fragos (2017) from the sfh module and a user specified star formation rate model and connects to populations synthesized on a regular grid of metallicity spaced uniform in log10(Z)

generate_universe(n_sample, n_downsample, ...)

Generates a universe of star formation by sampling metallicities and redshifts according to the user specified star formation rate model, a mean metallicity evolution from Madau & Fragos (2017) and a log normal metallicity distribution with sigma_log10Z out to redshift z_max then connects these formation redshifts and metallicities to COSMIC data for merging compact objects to create a merger catalog

md_zs(sfr_model, z_max)

A generator that returns redshifts of formation drawn from the user-specified SFR model

cosmerge.sfh Module¶

Contains cosmic star formation information

Functions¶

log_p_Z_z(Z, z, sigma_log10Z)

Computes the metallicity and redshift log probability distribution function assuming a log normal metallicity distribution with sigma at each redshift

md_14(z)

The Madau & Dickinson (2014) star formation rate per comoving volume as a function of redshift

mean_metal_log_z(z[, Zsun])

Mass-weighted average log(metallicity) as a function of redshift From Madau & Fragos (2017)

mf_17(z)

The Madau & Fragos (2017) star formation rate per comoving volume as a function of redshift

cosmerge.param_dists Module¶

methods for making distribution functions for rates

Functions¶

get_dN_dtlb_dV(t_lb)

Creates a kde of the merger lookback times Note that since t_lb has values -inf < t_lb < inf the kde is properly normalized to be evaluated at t_lb > 0 or z(t_lb > 0)

get_dN_dtlb_dlnm1_dlnm2_dV(t_lb, m1, m2)

Creates a kde of the merger lookback times, masses, and mass ratios Note that since t_lb has values -inf < t_lb < inf the kde is properly normalized to be evaluated at t_lb > 0 or z(t_lb > 0), to enforce proper mass boundaries we return dln(m) and dlogit(q)

get_dN_dtlb_dlnm_dV(t_lb, m)

Creates a kde of the merger lookback times and masses Note that since t_lb has values -inf < t_lb < inf the kde is properly normalized to be evaluated at t_lb > 0 or z(t_lb > 0) and to enforce proper mass boundaries, we return dln(m)

get_dN_dtlb_dlnm_dZ_dV(t_lb, m, Z)

Creates a kde of the merger lookback times, masses, and mass ratios Note that since t_lb has values -inf < t_lb < inf the kde is properly normalized to be evaluated at t_lb > 0 or z(t_lb > 0), to enforce proper mass boundaries we return dln(m) and dln(Z)

get_dN_dtlb_dlnm_dq_dV(t_lb, m, q)

Creates a kde of the merger lookback times, masses, and mass ratios Note that since t_lb has values -inf < t_lb < inf the kde is properly normalized to be evaluated at t_lb > 0 or z(t_lb > 0), to enforce proper mass boundaries we return dln(m) and dlogit(q)

get_pz(t_lb[, z_max])

Creates a pdf which predicts the probability of merger redshifts based on the rate at the detector per redshift: dN_dz_dtd

cosmerge.utils Module¶

contains utility methods

Functions¶

get_cosmic_data(path, kstar_1, kstar_2, mets)

Reads in all COSMIC data for specified metallicity grid

get_met_bins(mets)

Returns the bin edges for metallicity bins centered on supplied metallicities assuming a log_10 spaced metallicity grid

get_z_interp(z_max)

Generates an interpolation to convert between lookback time and redshift

parse_kstar(kstar)

Parses the kstar string labels into kstar values to select merger types

read_met_data(path, kstar_1, kstar_2, met_grid)

Reads in all COSMIC data for specified metallicity grid
